data.title: Obituaries from May 1993
data.text:
MARTIN BRUMMER

Martin Brummer, 89, of Cape Girardeau, died Saturday, May 1, 1993 at the Lutheran Home. Funeral arrangements are incomplete and will be announced by Ford and Sons Sprigg Street Chapel.

CARL E. SHEIBLE

MOUNDS, Ill. -- Funeral service for Carl E. Sheible, Mounds Route 1, will be held at 2 p.m. today at Barkett Funeral Chapel here. Burial will be in Spencer Heights Cemetery. Sheible, 59, died Friday, April 30, 1993, at St. Francis Medical Center in Cape Girardeau, Mo...

HELEN B. MCMAHAN

Funeral service for Helen B. McMahan was held Saturday at Ford and Sons Mt. Auburn Chapel, with Art Kelley officiating. McMahan, 55, 1232 Larry, died Thursday, April 29, 1993, at her home.

ESTHER B. SEBOLDT

JACKSON -- Esther B. Seboldt, 95, of Jackson, died Thursday, April 29, 1993, at the Lutheran Home in Cape Girardeau. She was born Oct. 3, 1897, in St. Peter, Ill., daughter of August and Louise Bahde Borchelt. She and the Rev. G.B. Seboldt were married Aug. 20, 1922, in St. Peter. He died Aug. 20, 1973...

LORAN WOOLEY

ANNA, Ill. -- Funeral service for Loran Wooley of Anna will be held at 2:30 p.m. today at Crain Funeral Chapel here. The Revs. Gerald Bethards, J.D. Morrison and Robert Goins will officiate, with burial in Anna Cemetery. Friends may call at the funeral home until service time...

LOUIS L. WHITLOCK

EAST PRAIRIE -- Louis Leland Whitlock, 82, of East Prairie, died Friday, April 30, 1993, at the John J. Pershing V.A. Medical Center in Poplar Bluff. He was born June 9, 1910, at Wyatt, Mo., son of Henry Thomas and Gertie Keeton Whitlock. Whitlock married Elva Suits in 1937. She died in 1979...

MARY E. MARTINEZ

SIKESTON -- Mary Elizabeth Martinez, 81, formerly of Crowder and a resident of the Hunter Acres Caring Center in Sikeston, died April 30, 1993, at the Missouri Delta Medical Center in Sikeston. She was born Dec. 11, 1911, in Sikeston to the late William J. and Rena F. Marshall Pratt. She was a seamstress, and was formerly employed at a dress manufacturing company in St. Louis...

CLYDE HAROLD SMITH

DELTA, Mo. Clyde H. Smith, 74, of Delta, Mo., died Saturday, May 1, 1993, at Southeast Missouri Hospital in Cape Girardeau. He was born march 29, 1919, at Delta, Mo., son of Charles Henry and Lucresia Mahaffey Smith. He married Kathryn Ruth Edwards, Nov. 6, 1943, at Elkton, Md...

MARGARET ANN MADALON

PERRYVILLE -- Margaret Ann Madalon of Patton, 52, died Friday, April 30, at Southeast Missouri Hospital in Cape Girardeau. She was born Sept. 19, 1940, in Sikeston, daughter of Forest and Myrtle Boyd Parks. She was married to Kent P. Madalon on June 18, 1960. He survives...

VIRGIA M. KAMP

JACKSON -- Virgia M. Kamp, 83, of the Jackson Manor, formerly of Poplar Bluff, died Saturday, May 1, 1993, at Saint Francis Medical Center in Cape Girardeau. She was born June 20, 1909, at Sedgewickville, daughter of Louis and Emma Conrad Statler. She married Otto A. Kamp, Oct. 29, 1938, at St. Louis...

FRIEDA A. SCHOEN

Frieda A. Schoen, 94, died Saturday, May 1, 1993 at the Lutheran Home. Friends may call today from 5-8 p.m. at the Ford & Sons Sprigg St. Chapel. Funeral arrangements were incomplete by press time and will be announced later by the funeral home.

CARL BERRY

Carl Berry of rural Kevil, Ky. died Sunday, May 2, 1993, at the Cape Girardeau Nursing Center. Arrangements are incomplete at the Lorberg Memorial Funeral Chapel in Cape Girardeau.

MARTIN J. BRUMMER

Martin J. Brummer, 89, of Cape Girardeau died Saturday, May 1, 1993, at the Lutheran Home. He was born April 6, 1904, at Leopold, the son of Bernard and Francis Van Doren Brummer. On July 27, 1935, he marred Dora L. Frueh, who preceded him in death...

FRIEDA ALVINA SCHOEN

Frieda Alvina Schoen, 94, of Cape Girardeau died Saturday, May 1, 1993, at the Lutheran Home. She was born June 11, 1898, at Tilsit, the daughter of Ferdinand and Pauline Kuehle Hargens. On April 20, 1919, she married Theodore Schoen in Advance. He preceded her in death Nov. 2, 1971...

CLARENCE F. DIAMOND

Clarence F. Diamond, 84, of 417 Albert in Cape Girardeau died Sunday, May 2, 1993, at his home. He was born Dec. 12, 1908, in Perry County, the son of Theodore and Martha Cook Diamond. On Oct. 15, 1927, he married Agnes E. Glueck, who preceded him in death May 12, 1977...

LUTHER COLLINS

Luther Collins, 71, of 1920 LaWanda died Sunday, May 2, 1993, at Southeast Missouri Hospital in Cape Girardeau. He was born Dec. 17, 1921, at Schlatitz, the son of James Henderson and Holly Tine Roberts Collins. He married Irene G. Shell on Jan. 19, 1943, in Piggott, Ark. She survives of the home...

EDNA BERNICE BUCKETT

She was born Dec. 18, 1908, in Arkansas to the late John and Ruth Meyers. She had lived in the St. Louis area for the past 15 years and was a member of the Shepley Church of Christ in St. Louis. She married William Virgil Burkett on Sept. 15, 1925. He preceded her in death on May 16, 1977. Three sons, one daughter, four brothers and six sisters also preceded her in death...

BESSIE ADAMS

JACKSON -- Bessie Adams, 87, Jackson Route 1, died Monday, May 3, 1993, at Jackson Manor. She was born Jan. 11, 1906, in the Leemon community, daughter of Pink and Ollie McNeely Morton. She and Paul Adams were married Aug. 6, 1941. Adams graduated from Southeast Missouri State University in 1932. She taught school at Bucoda, Cape Girardeau, Chaffee and Fruitland. She also worked 10 years at the Owl Shanty Cafe in Fruitland...

HAROLD P. BEARDSLEE

Harold Paul Beardslee, 84, 727 Bellevue, died Sunday, May 2, 1993, at St. Francis Medical Center. He was born April 18, 1909, at Commerce, son of Paul and Francis Groves Beardslee. He and Valerie Allais Skarg were married April 18, 1952. Beardslee had owned a car dealership in Grosse Pointe, Mich., and had worked at various Chrysler dealerships. He served in the U.S. Army during World War II...

ALOIS A. KOELLER

PERRYVILLE -- Funeral mass for Alois A. "Ollie" Koeller of Perryville was held Monday at St. Vincent's Catholic Church. The Rev. Henry Grodecki officiated, with burial in Mt. Hope Cemetery. Young and Sons Funeral Home was in charge of arrangements. Koeller, 82, died Saturday, May 1, 1993, at his home...

GEORGE L. TRAIN

A memorial service for George L. Train of Lindsborg, Kan., will be held at 11 a.m. today at Bethany Lutheran Church there. The Rev. Herbert N. Johnson Jr. will officiate, with private burial in Elmwood Cemetery at Lindsborg. Anderson-Hays Funeral Home in Lindsborg is in charge of arrangements...

JOHN W. MCMULLIN

SCOTT CITY -- John William "Bill" McMullin, 70, of Grubenville, formerly of the Scott City area, died Sunday, May 2, 1993, at his home. He was born Jan. 3, 1923, at Fornfelt, son of William and Emma Lipps McMullin. McMullin was a retired clerk with Cotton Belt Railroad. He was a member of the United Methodist Church and Masonic Lodge in Grubenville...

LILLARD S. RANSOM

CAIRO, Ill. -- Lillard S. "Shot" Ransom, 78, of Cairo, died Monday, May 3, 1993, at Daystar Care Center in Cairo. He was born Dec. 1, 1914, in Cunningham, Ky., son of Carl and Lealier Edwards Ransom. Ransom was a retired bailiff and deputy with Alexander County Sheriff's Department, and served as county coroner several years. He was a member of American Legion, and was a Republican precinct committeman in Cairo many years. He was a veteran of World War II...

MYRTLE M. BURTON

JONESBORO, Ill. -- Myrtle M. Burton, 86, of Jonesboro, died Tuesday, May 4, 1993, at Union County Hospital in Anna. She was born Aug. 11, 1906, in Union County, daughter of Delph and Delia Toler Knupp. She and Robert Burton were married in 1921 in Cape Girardeau. He died in 1974...

HINKLE JACO

MILLERSVILLE -- Hinkle "Hank" Jaco, 80, of Millersville, died Tuesday, May 4, 1993, at Jackson Manor. He was born Aug. 12, 1912, near Patton, son of John and Paralee Wilfong Jaco. Jaco was a farmhand in the area, retiring in 1973. Survivors include a son, Johnny C. Jaco of Illinois, and a brother, Robert Jaco of Millersville...

EDWIN J. KASSEL

ADVANCE -- Edwin J. Kassel, 85, of Clayton, La., formerly of Advance, died Monday, May 3, 1993, at Riverland Medical Center in Ferriday, La. He was born Dec. 23, 1907, at Uniontown, son of Christian Phillip and Sulameth Hopfer Kassel. He and Hazel Warnaka were married Aug. 31, 1934. She died June 17, 1985...

MARY E. SLINKARD

JACKSON -- Mary E. Slinkard, 99, of Jackson, formerly of Glen Allen, died Monday, May 3, 1993, at Southeast Missouri Hospital. She was born Nov. 7, 1893, in the Mayfield community, daughter of Henry M. and Mary C. Killian Yount. He and Henry E. Slinkard were married Aug. 1, 1920. He died Nov. 25, 1940...

ARTHUR C. SQUIRES

Arthur Coley Squires, 79, 811 Ranney, died Sunday, May 2, 1993, at Cape Girardeau Nursing Center. He was born May 29, 1913, in St. Louis, son of Coley and Effie Squires. He and the former Rosina Buckley were married Aug. 16, 1941, in Cape Girardeau...

LOUISE ALMA HARRIS

SCOTT CITY -- Louise Alma Harris, 84, of Scott City, died Tuesday, May 4, 1993, at Doctors Regional Medical Center in Poplar Bluff. The Amick-Burnett Funeral Chapel in Scott City is in charge of funeral arrangements, which are incomplete at this time...

CALVIN WALKER

SIKESTON -- Calvin Walker, 46, of Bell City, Mo., died Friday, April 30 , 1993, at his home. He was born Sept. 19, 1946, at Bell City, son of Vallet and Florence Davis Walker of Sikeston. He was an employee of Procter and Gamble of Cape Girardeau and a member of the St. John Missionary Baptist Church in Sikeston...

MARY ANN BLAGG

CHARLESTON -- Mary Ann Blagg, 81, of Paducah, Ky., formerly of Charleston, died Tuesday, May 4, 1993, at the Western Baptist Hospital in Paducah, Ky. She was born Sept 2, 1911, at Ballard County, daughter of William Douglas and Ella Gertrude Medlin Terrell...

HAZEL A. NISWONGER

Hazel A. Niswonger, 77, 1029 S. Benton, died Wednesday, May 5, 1993, at Southeast Missouri Hospital. She was born May 4, 1916, at Patton, daughter of Ray E. and Hannah E. McGraw Grindstaff. Niswonger was a child care provider in various homes in Cape Girardeau, and was a member of Gospel Assembly Church...

LOUISE A. HARRIS

SCOTT CITY -- Louise Alma Harris, 84, of Scott City, died Tuesday, May 4, 1993, at Doctors' Regional Medical Center in Poplar Bluff. She was born June 4, 1908, in Princeton, Ky., daughter of Alvin and Birch Crews Wilson. She and Clifton Pearl Harris were married June 10, 1925. He died June 2, 1959...

CARL BERRY

Funeral service for Carl Berry of Kevil, Ky., will be held at 1:30 p.m. today at Lorberg Memorial Funeral Chapel. The Rev. Earl Cox and Floyd Penny will officiate, with burial in Fairmount Cemetery. Friends may call at the funeral home after 10 a.m...

HELEN NASH

DONGOLA -- Helen Nash, 70, of Dongola died May 5, 1993, at Union County Hospital in Anna. No services wil be held. The Crain Funeral Home of Dongola is in charge of arrangements.

MABEL L. RITTER

Mabel L. Ritter, 89, died Wednesday, May 5, 1993 at St. Francis Medical Center. She was born July 25, 1903 to Monroe and Albenia Clingingsmith Kurre. Funeral arrangements are incomplete and will be announced by McCombs Funeral Home in Jackson.

ROSE I. STROUD

PERRYVILLE -- Rose I. Stroud, 86, of Perryville, died Wednesday, May 5, 1993, at Perry County Nursing Home in Perryville. She was born July 10. 1906, at Vergennes, Ill., daughter of Jacob G. and Magnolia Crow Quillman. She was married to James H. Stroud, April 14, 1960. He died March 31, 1989...

LESLIE E. "BEAN" PARNELL

THEBES, Ill. - Leslie E. "Bean" Parnell, 62, of Thebes, Rt. 1, died at his home on Thursday, May 6, 1993. He was born June 20, 1930, in East St. Louis, to Horace and Zola Boswell Parnell. Parnell married Juanita Burns. She survives of the home. Other survivors include one son, Richard "Dicky" Parnell of Dupo, Ill., one daughter, Cindy Palmer of Pulaski, Ill., one sister, Lucille Patterson of Thebes, and four grandchildren...

CLARA M. HALTER

Clara M. Halter, 94, 114 S. Benton, died Thursday, May 6, 1993, at the Lutheran Home. She was born Aug. 25, 1898, at Longtown, daughter of Bernard and Mary Tuschoff Meyer. She and Ben J. Halter were married May 27, 1924, at Apple Creek. He died in 1951...

GENEVIEVE M. SLINKARD

JACKSON -- Genevieve Mary Slinkard, 86, of Jackson, died Tuesday, May 4, 1993, at her home. She was born Oct. 30, 1906, at Serno, daughter of John and Laura Prue Bernard. She and Luther Marion Slinkard were married Sept. 25, 1926, in St. Louis. Slinkard was sales manager 25 years with Stanley Home Products in Kansas City, retiring in 1957. ...

PERLIE M. MCRAVEN

JONESBORO, Ill. -- Perlie Mae McRaven, 62, of Buncombe, died Wednesday, May 5, 1993, at Southeast Missouri Hospital in Cape Girardeau. She was born March 17, 1931, in Tennessee, daughter of Jimmy and Mildred Smith. She and Lynn McRaven were married April 15, 1972. He died June 7, 1989...

FLORENCE LOWES

JACKSON -- Florence "Polly" Lowes, 90, of Jackson, died Wednesday, May 5, 1993, at Deal Nursing Home. She was born Oct. 8, 1902, at Uniontown, daughter of Marvin Elliott and Marcella Ann Hoffman Martin. She and Edmund Wilkens were married in March 1924. He died in November 1949. She later married Emory Lowes Aug. 15, 1950. He died Dec. 1, 1966...

SHARA E. SUGGS

SIKESTON -- Funeral service for Shara Elizabeth Faye Suggs of Sikeston will be held at 2 p.m. today at Nunnelee Funeral Chapel. The Rev. Jim Guffie will officiate, with burial in Memorial Park Cemetery. Shara, 2 months, died Wednesday, May 5, 1993, at Missouri Delta Medical Center...

MABEL L. RITTER

Mabel L. Ritter, 89, of Chateau Girardeau, formerly of Jackson, died Wednesday, May 5, 1993, at St. Francis Medical Center. She was born July 25, 1903, at Kurreville, daughter of Monroe and Albenia Clingingsmith Kurre. She and Clarence J. "Brick" Ritter were married June 27, 1930, at Jackson. He died Oct. 21, 1976...

MARY M. DECKER

SCOTT CITY -- A memorial service for Mary Minnie Decker of Scott City will be held at 2 p.m. Sunday at 217 E. Ash Street in Scott City. Amick-Burnett Funeral Home here is in charge of arrangements. Decker, 49, died Sunday, May 2, 1993, at her home. She was born Dec. 27, 1943, in Alabama, daughter of Thomas Jefferson and Leona Alderson Decker...

L.T. TACKETT

Funeral service for L.T. Tackett of House Springs will be held at 1 p.m. Saturday at Britton Funeral Chapel of Potosi. The Rev. Danny Anderson will officiate, with burial in Sunset Hill Cemetery. Tackett, 66, died Tuesday, May 4, 1993, at Vencore Hospital in St. Louis...

REV. ARNOLD E. THOMURE

Rev. Arnold E. Thomure, 77, of Cape Girardeau, Rt. 1, died Thursday, May 6, 1993, at the Cape Girardeau Lutheran Home. The body is at Ford and Sons Mt. Auburn Chapel. Visitation is tentatively scheduled for Saturday evening.

DELMA M. FRENTZEL

PERRYVILLE -- Funeral service for Delma M. Frentzel of Perryville was held Saturday at Young and Sons Funeral Chapel. The Rev. Paul Winningham officiated, with burial in Grace Lutheran Cemetery at Uniontown. Frentzel, 79, died Thursday, May 6, 1993, at Perry County Memorial Hospital...

L.C. CATHRON

CHARLESTON -- Funeral service for L.C. Cathron of Charleston was held Saturday at St. Mark Baptist Church. The Rev. Wiley Reed officiated, with burial in Oak Grove Cemetery. Sparks Funeral Home was in charge of arrangements. Cathron, 72, died Wednesday, May 5, 1993, at John J. Pershing VA Medical Center in Poplar Bluff...

CARL HARRISON

CHARLESTON -- Funeral service for Carl "Dickie" Harrison of Charleston will be held at noon today at Sparks Funeral Chapel. The Rev. Laverne Frazier will officiate, with burial in Oak Grove Cemetery. Friends may call at the funeral home from 10 a.m. to service time...

REV. ARNOLD THOMURE

Funeral service for the Rev. Arnold Earl Thomure of Cape Girardeau will be held at 1 p.m. today at Ford and Sons Mt. Auburn Chapel. The Rev. Bobby Mouser will officiate, with burial in New Lorimier Cemetery. Thomure, 77, died Thursday, May 6, 1993, at the Lutheran Home...

STEVEN D. SHOEMAKER

ORAN -- Funeral service for Steven Darrell Shoemaker of Oran was held Saturday at Amick-Burnett Funeral Chapel in Chaffee. The Rev. Brian Gill officiated, with burial in Williams Cemetery at Perkins. Shoemaker, 21, died Thursday, May 6, 1993, at Southeast Missouri Hospital...

PRUDENCE MCMULLIN

Prudence Cotner McMullin, 95, of Cape Girardeau, died Friday, May 7, 1993, at Fountainbleau Lodge. She was born July 13, 1897, at Neely's Landing, daughter of Francis M. and Margaret J. Medlock McClard. She and James E. Cotner were married April 4, 1912, at Jackson. He died July 15, 1967. She later married Amos McMullin Oct. 6, 1974, in Cape Girardeau. He died May 25, 1988...

ROSEY LETGRATE

MARBLE HILL -- Rosey Letgrate, 90, of Glen Allen, died Thursday, May 6, 1993, at Bond Nursing Care Center in Marble Hill. She was born at Lake City, Ark., Aug. 2, 1902, daughter of Joe and Fanny Cato Farmer. Her husband, Dave Letgrate, died May 24, 1974...

HERSHEL K. ROUSSEL

Funeral service for Hershel Kenneth Roussel of Flovilla, Ga., was held May 5 at Haisten Funeral Chapel in Jackson, Ga. The Rev. Gary Jakes officiated, with burial in Juliette United Methodist Church Cemetery in Juliette, Ga. Roussel, 76, died Monday, May 3, 1993, at his home...

LECTORIA HONY

SIKESTON -- Lectoria Wren Hony, 76, of Norwood, Ohio, formerly of Sikeston, died Saturday, May 8, 1993, at the Christ Hospital in Cincinnati, Ohio. The Nunley Funeral Home in Sikeston is in charge of funeral arrangements, which are incomplete at this time...

CLARA E. LAWRENCE

Clara E. Lawrence, 86, formerly of Cape Girardeau, died Saturday May 8, 1993 at the Ramona Villa Nursing Home in Kansas City. She was born Jan. 30, 1907 in Burfordville, the daughter of Columbus C. and Rosine Schwab Smith. In 1930 she married James F. Lawrence in Arkansas, and he preceded her in death on Jan. 10, 1969...

LAWRENCE E. SCHEFFER

CHAFFEE - Lawrence Edward Scheffer, 73, of Chaffee, died Saturday May 8, 1993 at Southeast Missouri Hospital. He was born Feb. 19, 1920 in Charleston, the son of Clem and Emma Gibbear Scheffer. On Sept. 28, 1940 he married Adella Heisserer, who survives. He was a retired milk truck driver for Pevely Dairy...

ROBERT K. GRANT

JACKSON - Robert K. Grant, 80, formerly of Jackson, died Friday May 7, 1993 at a hospital in Hot Springs Village, Ark. Local arrangements are pending at McCombs Funeral Home in Jackson.

BRENDA M. HARTMANN

Brenda McGuffie Hartmann, 60, of Venice, Fla., formerly of Cape Girardeau, died Saturday, May 8, 1993, at her residence. Hartmann was born Feb. 3, 1933, in Bolton, England, and moved to Venice in 1984 from Cape Girardeau. She is survived by her husband, Helmut Hartmann; two sons, Stephen Parks of Chino, Calif., and Jonathan Parks of Jefferson City; one daughter, Kimberly Schlosser of Chaffee; one sister, Mary Barlow of Bolton, England, along with five grandchildren...

JOHN LEE MORGAN

BERTRAND, Mo. - John Lee Morgan, 63, of Bertrand, died Saturday, May 8, 1993, at the Charleston Manor in Charleston. He was born Nov. 7, 1929, in St. Louis, to Harry and Le Mae Stoefiel Morgan. On July 9, 1954, he married Marian Adele Pilgrim, who preceded him in death on Dec. 17, 1992...

BOBBIE T. SMITH

Bobbie T. Smith of Creve Coeur, formerly of Cape Girardeau, died Friday, May 7, 1993, at the Bridgeton Nursing Center in Bridgeton. The body is being returned to Ford and Sons Mt. Auburn Chapel. Funeral arrangements are pending.

FRANK T. SPRINGMEYER

Frank T. "Springie" Springmeyer, 84, of 105 N. Clark died Friday, May 7, 1993, at Southeast Missouri Hospital. He was born March 30, 1909 in Elvins, son of Conrad Henry and Alice Pratt Springmeyer. He was employed as a truck driver for Cauble & Field for more than 25 years...

BERTHA V. BURNS ROFKAHR

SIKESTON -- Bertha V. Burns Rofkahr, 64, of Sikeston died Friday, May 7, 1993, at Missouri Delta Medical Center. She was born May 10, 1928 in Johnson County, Ark., daughter of John and Joyce Yates Murphy. She was a sewing machine operator for International Shoe Co. for more than 30 years. She was a member of the Emmanuel Baptist Church and the Sikeston Eagles Aerie No. 3319...

BOBBY LEE SELVY

Bobby Lee Selvy, 24, of 433 S. Ellis St. died there May 7. 1993. He was born Oct. 29, 1968, in Turrel, Ark., the son of Otis Brown and Erma Jean Gray. His father survives of Crawfordville, Ark. His mother survives of Cape Girardeau. He also is survived by one son, Jermery Walker of Chicago; three brothers, Patrick Lee Selvy, Tracy Lee Selvy and Antonio Gray, all of Cape Girardeau; and one sister, Renesha Brown of Cape Girardeau...

EDITH C. RHODES

MARBLE HILL -- Edith C. Rhodes, 78, of Marble Hill, died Saturday, May 8, 1993, at Bond Nursing Care Center in Marble Hill. She was born Oct. 19, 1914, at Glen Allen, Mo., daughter of Marvin and Lula Buehler Walker. She was married to Ernest Rhodes, March 25, 1938. He died May 22, 1975...

SARAH BURNS WRIGHT

SIKESTON -- Sarah Burns Wright, 73, of Poplar Bluff, formerly of Sikeston, died Sunday, May 9, 1993, at the Missouri Delta Medical Center in Sikeston. She was born Sept. 19, 1919, at Sikeston, daughter of Roy M. and Hallie J. Wyatt Johnson. She married Ray Burns Dec. 12, 1936. He died April 6, 1974...

LECTORIA WREN HONY

SIKESTON -- Lectoria Wren Hony, 76, formerly of Sikeston and a resident of Norwood, Ohio, died May 8, 1993, at Christ Hospital in Cincinnati. She was born Dec. 17, 1916, at Charter Oak, Mo., to the late Noah and Lizzie Dismuke Tippy. She was a housewife and homemaker, and a former member of the First United Pentecostal Church in Sikeston...

SARAH A. MESSMER

CHAFFEE -- Sarah Ann Messmer was stillborn Sunday, May 9, 1993, at Missouri Delta Medical Center in Sikeston. She is the daughter of Edward and Jennifer Bolt Messmer of Chaffee. Survivors include her parents; a brother, Phillip Messmer of the home; paternal grandparents, Janie Simpson of Chaffee, Jan Messmer of Cape Girardeau; maternal grandparents, Willard Bolt of Oran, and Pattie Bolt of Reno, Nev...

GOLDIA CARROLL

SCOTT CITY -- Goldia Carroll, 79, of Scott City, died Monday, May 10, 1993, at Cape Girardeau Nursing Center. She was born July 15, 1913, at Allenville, daughter of Fred and Lula Harmon Thompson. She married Silas Tilas Carroll April 12, 1938. He died June 1, 1965...

ROBERT K. GRANT

JACKSON -- Graveside memorial service for Robert K. Grant of Hot Springs Village, Ark., will be held at 11 a.m. Wednesday at Russell Heights Cemetery. The Rev. Rodney Travis will officiate. There is no visitation. McCombs Funeral Home is in charge of arrangements...

BOBBIE T. SMITH

Funeral service for Bobbie T. Smith of Creve Coeur, formerly of Cape Girardeau, will be held at 10:30 a.m. today at Christ Episcopal Church. Rector Frank Crumbaugh Jr. will officiate, with burial in Hobbs Chapel Cemetery. There is no visitation. Ford and Sons Mt. Auburn Chapel is in charge of arrangements...

BRENDA M. HARTMANN

A memorial service for Brenda M. Hartmann of Venice, Fla., formerly of Cape Girardeau, will be held at 7 p.m. Friday in the chapel at Southeast Missouri Hospital. Chaplain Raymond Otto will officiate. Hartmann, 60, died Saturday, May 8, 1993, at her home...

ELAINE WARD

MATTHEWS -- Elaine Ward, 77, Matthews Route 1, died Monday, May 10, 1993, at Sells Rest Home. She was born April 24, 1916, in Portageville, daughter of John and Ethel Neely Wilson. She married Earl Shackelford in 1931 at New Madrid. He died in January 1970. She later married Frank Ward...

WOODROW W. HUTSON

Woodrow Wilson Hutson, 70, 805 N. Spanish, died Monday, May 10, 1993, at his home. He was born Feb. 16, 1923 in Bennett, Mo. to H.W. Hutson and Bulah Keller Hutson. On Nov. 14, 1946, he married Luella Warren. She survives. He was an Army veteran of World War II...

ANDREA JO SMITH

PUXICO - Andrea Jo Smith, 32, of Puxico, died Monday, May 10, 1993 at her home in Poplar Bluff. She was born Feb. 16, 1961 in Poplar Bluff to Grady and Anne Smith of Puxico. They survive. Also surviving is her brother, Michael McGhee of Puxico. She worked as a registered nurse at Doctors Regional Medical Center in Poplar Bluff. She received a degree in nursing from Three Rivers Community College in Poplar Bluff...

OTIS B. MOUSER

Otis B. Mouser, 87, of Cape Girardeau, died Tuesday, May 11, 1993, at the Lutheran Home. He was born Oct. 1, 1905, at Miner, son of Benjamin and Della Knighton Mouser. He and Daisey Roxana Stephens were married June 16, 1937, at Sikeston. Mouser was a farm laborer for George Bader in McClure, Ill., retiring in 1965...

ELAINE WARD

MATTHEWS -- Funeral service for Elaine Ward of Matthews will be held at 1 p.m. today at Shelby Funeral Chapel in East Prairie. The Rev. Ernest Brown will officiate, with burial in East Prairie Memorial Park Cemetery. Ward, 77, died Monday, May 10, 1993, at Sells Rest Home...

STACK L. MCALISTER

CHAFFEE -- Stack Lee McAlister, 79, of Chaffee, died Tuesday, May 11, 1993, at St. Francis Medical Center in Cape Girardeau. He was born July 17, 1913, at Portageville, son of James William and Pearl Newhouse McAlister. He and Eva Rose were married Dec. 28, 1934. She died June 9, 1972. He later married Nora Ellen Dalton March 25, 1976. She died Jan. 25, 1987...

LOUIS SCOTT

CHARLESTON -- Funeral service for Louis Scott of Charleston will be held at 1 p.m. Saturday at Holy Trinity Church of Deliverance. Bishop James Whitfield will officiate, with burial in Oak Grove Cemetery. Friends may call at Sparks Funeral Home Friday from 7-8 p.m...

EARL REITZEL

JACKSON -- Earl Reitzel, 77, of Jackson, died Monday, May 10, 1993, in a farm tractor accident. He was born Oct. 16, 1915, at Jackson, son of William and Sophia Schille Reitzel. He and Olga Schweer were married Oct. 14, 1939. Reitzel farmed north of Jackson all his life, and from 1953-81 he was also a dairyman. In 1956-57 he was recognized as an outstanding farmer by receiving a Certificate of Merit from Jefferson City for accomplishments in soil conservation...

ROBERT L. RUSHING

PERRYVILLE -- Robert L. Rushing, 67, of Perryville, died Tuesday, May 11, 1993, at the John Cochran Veterans Hospital in St. Louis. He was born April 4, 1926, at East St. Louis, Ill., son of Benjamin and Flossie Estella Hancock Rushing. He was married to Leta V. DeClue, July 2, 1977...

MARLENE CROY

Marlene Croy, 43, of Tucson, Ariz., formerly of Cape Girardeau, died Wednesday, May 5, 1993, at Northwest Hospital in Tucson. She was born July 4, 1949, in Chicago, daughter of Nick and Lillian Schwarz. Survivors include her husband, Billy Joe, formerly of McClure, Ill.; a son, Michael Marston of Cape Girardeau; two stepdaughters, Mary Croy of Searcy, Ark., Rebecca Davis of Houston, Texas; two sisters, Sharon and B.J. Schwarz of Cape Girardeau, and two stepgrandchildren...

ELSIE M. TEST

CHARLESTON -- Elsie Marie Test, 92, of the Bertrand Nursing Facility, died there Tuesday, May 11, 1993. She was born Oct. 10, 1900, at Charleston, daughter of George David and Amalia Reginia Ketterer Test. She was co-owner of Test Grocery here until retiring in 1975. She was a member of St. Henry's Catholic Church...

BERTHA L. SMITH

SCOTT CITY -- Bertha Lee Smith, 93, of Scott City, died Wednesday, May 12, 1993, at her home. She was born Aug. 9, 1899, at Delta, daughter of Charles Henry and Mary Elizabeth Scarlets Kynion. She and Odis Millard Smith were married April 26, 1917, at Delta. He died Aug. 31, 1966...

RUTH SAMS
